title: bug: Ethstats request stacking on websocket failures

### Description
When besu is configured to send stats to an ethstats server, intermittent (or persistent) errors publishing the stats will cause a "stacking" behavior.  If left in this state for long enough besu begins to spend almost all of its runtime trying to deliver failed ethstats messages

### Acceptance Criteria
* besu should discard failed ethstats requests upon too many retries


### Steps to Reproduce (Bug)
1. configure and run besu with an ethstats server
2. interrupt the ethstats websocket connection

**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]
ethstats messages permanently fail

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]
ethstats messages get infinitely retried

**Frequency:** [What percentage of the time does it occur?]
depends on the upstream ethstats server

### Versions (Add all that apply)
* Software version: 22.1.x
